subSubSection.paragraph: Like Caribbomerusribbomerus attenuatus (Chevrolat) and Caribbomerus similis (Fisher), Caribbomerus asperatus has a very diagnostic rugulose pronotum that lacks calli and pubescence. It is recognized by a combination of features that include the matte finish on the elytra, micropunctation between elytral punctures, relatively uniform reddish-brown coloration above, distinctly elevated antennal tubercles, and elytral apices not distinctly impunctate.
